revised_title: On the Variation of the Specific Heat of Water: A Review of Experimental Work and Methods
tldr: This article reviews the experimental evidence and methods used to study the variation of the specific heat of water. The author discusses the challenges in comparing results from different observers and the importance of using accurate thermometric scales and units. The article also highlights the need for further experiments to provide more accurate and reliable data on the specific heat variation between 0°C and 100°C.
